alert.note: Alert for Crawford (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 10:33AM EST until February 20 at 10:36AM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... French Creek At Meadville affecting Crawford County. For the French Creek...including Meadville...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Creek At Meadville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Floodwaters reach Columbia Avenue, Race Street, and Rogers Ferry Road. Residents of Asbury East and West Mobile Home Parks are impacted. Bicentennial Park near Mead Street is flooded. Water may impact traffic at the U.S. 322 bypass near Park Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Saturday the stage was 14.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EST Saturday was 14.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 9.2 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.0 feet on 02/07/2008. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening by 845 PM EST.
